objectives

¢ Activate and configure straight-through
invoice processing (STIP)

slides.originalNotes:
Review: services and service requests
A service is the work that needs to be done. A service request is the record of communications with the vendor (request service, receive/approve quote, receive/pay invoice, and so on)
Vendors are typically stored in an address book application (such as Guidewire ContactManager), and retrieved when needed for services.
slides.notes:
Review: services and service requests

Vendors are typically stored in an address book application (such as Guidewire ContactManager), and retrieved when needed for services.

slides.originalNotes:
Review: service request types
Note: Service request type is distinct from service type, which is the kind of service being quoted or performed.
It is possible to create other service request types and their associated state handlers by extending ServiceRequestStateHandler.gs;  but the details of doing this are outside the scope of this course.

ZIJnmanaged Service" service requests are created only in the Auto First and Final wizard. The adjuster can proceed directly to add invoices and make payments once the wizard is complete.

slides.originalNotes:
Service definitions (conceptual)
This is a conceptual view of how services are defined in the application. There are three possible "levels" of services, arranged in a hierarchy that allows services to be organized into categories and subcategories. 

The •tree" structure is defined in an xml file we shall see in a few slides.

An example of the three levels:
Auto" ("svc:aut") is a top-level service definitiom
Auto inspection“ ("svc:aut_ins") is a second- level service category.
Auto inspect and repair audio" ("svc:aut_ins_aud") is a third-level subcategory.

The three-level structure is somewhat arbitrary and can be extended with a bit of work.
slides.notes:

slides.originalNotes:
vendorservicetreeexml
The file vendorservicetree.xml defines the hierarchy of services for a ClaimCenter implementation.
This file is found at configuration > config > sampledata > vendorservicetree.xml.
You can add levels to the hierarchy simply by adding a fourth level of referentiality to the vendor service tree. However, this will also require significant configuration of the I-II, as there is no way, in the base application, to display a fourth level of services.

The screenshot shows two root nodes / service definitions ("svc:acc" for •accommodation“ and csvc:aut" for •auto") and one leaf node / service category a child of •svc:acc", for zalternative accommodation").

This file is also present in Guidewire ContactManager,  enabling easy search for a particular service provider type.

slides.originalNotes:
vendorservicedetails.xml — request kinds
vendorservicedetails.xml is basically a set of associations. Request kinds associate a request kind with a leaf node service- (A given service may be associated with more than one request kind.)
This file is found at configuration > config > sampledata > vendorservicedetails.xml. The base application includes four request kinds: quote only, quote and service, service only, and unmanaged. Unmanaged is only available in the Auto First and Final wizard, where it is mandatory.
The Service Request Kind type list is extensible.
slides.notes:
vendorservicedetails.xml — request kinds
vendorservicedetails.xml is basically a set of associations. Request kinds associate a request kind with a leaf node service- (A given service may be associated with more than one request kind.)
This file is found at configuration > config > sampledata > vendorservicedetails.xml. The base application includes four request kinds: quote only, quote and service, service only, and unmanaged. Unmanaged is only available in the Auto First and Final wizard, where it is mandatory.
The Service Request Kind type list is extensible.

vendorservicedetails.xml — incident kinds
vendorservicedetails.xml is basically a set of associations. Incident types associate an incident type with a root node service. (A service may be associated with more than one incident type.)
Incident types are subtypes of the Incident class. In the base application, these include: Injury Incident.
Property Incident

slides.originalNotes:
Linking the vendor service tree to the vendor service details
Here is a set of examples of how the associations play out between the two files.

Auto (svc:aut) is a root node, and must be associated with one or more Incident Type.

Auto — Inspection / Repair — Audio Equipment (svc:aut_ins_aud) is a leaf node, and must be associated with one or more Service Request Kind.

Auto — Inspection / Repair (svc:aut_ins) is neither a leaf node nor a root node, and is not associated with the vendor service details at all.
slides.notes:
Linking the vendor service tree to the vendor service details
Here is a set of examples of how the associations play out between the two files.

Auto (svc:aut) is a root node, and must be associated with one or more Incident Type.

Auto — Inspection / Repair — Audio Equipment (svc:aut_ins_aud) is a leaf node, and must be associated with one or more Service Request Kind.

Auto — Inspection / Repair (svc:aut_ins) is neither a leaf node nor a root node, and is not associated with the vendor service details at all.

slides.originalNotes:
Two important notes
When you have finished editing the two vendor service files, you must import them using the Administration pages  (Administration > Utilities > Import Data), then restart the ClaimCenter server If you are using ContactManager and edit vendorservicetree.xml, you must do the same there.

A node which is not a child node cannot be associated with a service request kind, nor with a service provider. Therefore, if you attempt to import a service tree that adds a child to a node that has these associations, an error will occur.
slides.notes:
Two important notes
When you have finished editing the two vendor service files, you must import them using the Administration pages  (Administration > Utilities > Import Data), then restart the ClaimCenter server If you are using ContactManager and edit vendorservicetree.xml, you must do the same there.

A node which is not a child node cannot be associated with a service request kind, nor with a service provider. Therefore, if you attempt to import a service tree that adds a child to a node that has these associations, an error will occur.
slides.ocrText:
| Two important notes Gi

« When you have finished editing and importing vendorservicetree.xml and
vendorservicedetails.xml, you must restart ClaimCenter (and
ContactManager in the case of vendorservicetree. xml) for the changes to
take effect.

¢ Ifyou add a child node to a node whose service type has previously been
assigned to any service providers, then importing vendorservicetree.xml will
cause errors which must be corrected.

slides.originalNotes:
Service request history
History event records can be associated with a service request. Major events in the life cycle of a service request are listed on the History tab of the Services screen.
These history event records may include links to documents such as quotes and invoices.
slides.notes:

These history event records may include links to documents such as quotes and invoices.

slides.originalNotes:
Creating service request history
If you need to configure the creation of service request history records, use the recordChange() method of Service Request, as shown in the image.

There is a second signature for the

ServiceRequest.recordChange() method:

recordChange(newChange ServiceRequestChange)
Does not populate fields, but expects the caller to create and populate the ServiceRequestChange object
Does not have a return type
Is not used in the base application.

slides.originalNotes:
Service request metrics in the base application
Each service request has a set of associated metrics, which are calculated whenever the Details tab for that service request is displayed. Only those metrics are displayed which are relevant to the current service request; thus a eservice only" service request will not have the metrics involving quotes.
slides.notes:
Service request metrics in the base application
Each service request has a set of associated metrics, which are calculated whenever the Details tab for that service request is displayed. Only those metrics are displayed which are relevant to the current service request; thus a eservice only" service request will not have the metrics involving quotes.

2. Add the new metric to the implementation class

3. Test the changes
For full details, see the Guidewire ClaimCenter Configuration Guide.

Configuring Straight-Through
Invoice Processing (STIP)

| Straight-through invoice processing (STIP) Gi

« Automates the approval and payment of many routine invoices

« Payments can be made against Reserve Lines, at either the Claim or the
Exposure level

= 3807

| Helper classes Gi

¢ STIP is implemented using State Transition Helper classes
¢ Two helper classes in the base application:
* InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper manages automatic approvals
* InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper manages automatic payments
* To change the criteria for automatic processing, change the implementation of the
helper classes
v vendormanagement
© InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper
(3) InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin

‘C | InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper
© ServiceRequestMetricLimitFinderlmpl

| Helper methods Gi

Each helper has four required methods:

* getRelevantInvoices () returns a list of invoices to be processed
+ Inthe base application, returns invoices waiting to be approved or paid

« For each invoice returned by getRelevant Invoices, getFailedToQualifyReasons ()
returns a list of reasons why the invoice cannot be processed

* performAction() —if getFailedToQualifyReasons () returns an empty list, processes the
Invoice
* InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper marks the invoice as approved
* InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper creates a check and marks the invoice as paid

¢ registerFailure() —if the list of reasons is not empty, creates (or updates) an activity to

manually process the invoice

+ Activity patterns in the base application are INVOICE NOT AUTO APPROVED and
INVOICE NOT AUTO PAID

+ Activity includes the list of reasons not processed

| STIP in the UI Gi

On the Invoices tab, when the user clicks the button to pay an invoice which was not
previously approved, ClaimCenter invokes the invoice automatic processor.

Services

| Details | History | Activities | Documents | Notes | invoices | Messages

By

Invoice Ref# > Attention > Submitted Date > Amount > Status > Description > Check# $ CheckAmount  CheckStatus >

Details

Withdraw

ice waiting for payment

| Processor Gi

« When invoices enter the system, either manually or through an integration, a
“processor” is invoked

* This occurs after any regular Gosu rules are run on the invoice
¢ Runs independently of the bundle which creates the invoice
¢ Any prior work by the user is not affected
¢ Inthe provided implementation, the processor uses each helper as a “checklist”

« Each of a series of potential failure reasons is checked against each invoice associated with
the service request

¢ If none of the failure reasons match the invoice, the action, such as approval or
payment, is automatically performed

| Permissions Gi

The permissions and authority limits of the user who inputs an invoice are used in
determining whether the invoice can be automatically approved and paid.

Adjuster. vp«

auto-approved

largest amount that can be automatically approved

Currency. 7C_CAD -> 600bd,

,

InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper rejects invoices that exceed this amount

else if (invoice.Amount.Amount > smallaAmountThreshold) {
failureReasons.add("The amount is too high")
n

¢ To change the maximum amount that can be auto-approved, modify the
SmallAmountThresholds property

| Changing the kinds of processing that are Gi
automated

To change the kinds of processing automated by STIP, edit the
StateTransitionHelpers property of InvoiceAutoApproveAutoPayPlugin.

* Comment out one of the existing helpers

* Create and add your own helper
+ NOTE: Do this with extreme caution

override property get StateTransitionHelpers(): List<InvoiceAutomaticStateTransitionHelper> {
return {
InvoiceAutoApprovalHelper. Instance,
InvoiceAutoPaymentHelper. Instance
}
